meanings.definition: To compose again; to create or form anew.
meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, she recomposed her drawing to make it perfect.
meanings.sent2: The artist recomposed the melody to make it more harmonious.
meanings.sent3: He recomposed the puzzle pieces after his little brother mixed them up.
meanings.sent4: The garden was like a recomposed painting after the flowers were rearranged.
meanings.sent5: The chef recomposed the dish with new ingredients, making it even more delicious.

meanings.definition: To adjust or rearrange the elements of a composition.
meanings.sent1: She recomposed the furniture in the room to create more space.
meanings.sent2: The photographer recomposed the shot to capture the perfect angle.
meanings.sent3: The students recomposed their group project to include new ideas.
meanings.sent4: The dance routine was recomposed to better fit the music.
meanings.sent5: The team recomposed their strategy to win the game.

meanings.definition: To restore to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The old painting was recomposed to its original beauty by the skilled restorer.
meanings.sent2: The antique clock was recomposed to its former glory after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: He recomposed the broken vase, making it look as good as new.
meanings.sent4: The garden was recomposed to its former lushness with careful watering.
meanings.sent5: The music piece was recomposed to its original tempo for the performance.
